publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3220# John Scott: The Future Provision of Emergency and Unscheduled Care Services in Ayrshire and Arranâ€”That the Parliament notes the plans by NHS Ayrshire and Arran to institute a public consultation on the future provision of emergency and unscheduled care in Ayrshire; expresses concern that this consultation only includes options to downgrade the existing accident and emergency unit at Ayr Hospital, and expects NHS Ayrshire and Arran to abide by the spirit of the report, Building a Health Service Fit for the Future, by Professor David Kerr by listening to the views of both the public and health professionals in Ayrshire and taking full account of these views before reaching a decision on the future of accident and emergency care provision in the county.
S2M-3220# The Future Provision of Emergency and Unscheduled Care Services in Ayrshire and Arran (lodged on 1 September 2005) Campbell Martin*

S2M-3220# The Future Provision of Emergency and Unscheduled Care Services in Ayrshire and Arran (lodged on 1 September 2005) Murray Tosh*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Phil Gallie*, Derek Brownlee*, Rob Gibson*, Alex Johnstone*, Murdo Fraser*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Mary Scanlon*

S2M-3220# The Future Provision of Emergency and Unscheduled Care Services in Ayrshire and Arran (lodged on 1 September 2005) Mr David Davidson*, Mr Jamie McGrigor*, Alex Neil*, Mike Rumbles*, Bill Aitken*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Ms Sandra White*, Margaret Mitchell*
S2M-3220# The Future Provision of Emergency and Unscheduled Care Services in Ayrshire and Arran (lodged on 1 September 2005) Christine Grahame*
S2M-3220 #The Future Provision of Emergency and Unscheduled Care Services in Ayrshire and Arran (lodged on 1 September 2005) Miss Annabel Goldie*
